sense.gloss: to fly, to soar
to jump, to leap, to spring, to bound, to hop
to spatter, to scatter, to splash, to fly (e.g. of sparks)
to hurry, to rush
to flee, to run off, to escape
to disappear, to vanish, to fade, to thin out
to break off, to come off, to fall off, to blow (of a fuse)
to be sent out (of an order), to fly (of false rumours, catcalls, etc.)
to come flying (of a punch, kick, etc.)
to be missing (of a page, stitch, etc.), to skip, to jump (e.g. of a conversation)
flying, leaping, flight, leap
zero, naught, oh
flying fish (esp. the Japanese flying fish, Cypselurus agoo)
running out of points (zero or fewer), game ending due to a player running out of points
to jump out, to rush out, to fly out
to appear (suddenly)
to protrude, to project
to butt in
to run away (e.g. from home), to break away, to cut ties with (e.g. workplace)
(a) jump
splashes (usu. of mud)
upward turn at the bottom (e.g. of a vertical stroke of a kanji or of a hairdo)
close (e.g. of a theatrical performance), breakup
jump, leap, skip, bound
to jump at, to be attracted by
to jump up, to spring up, to leap
to move around, to bounce up and down
to pound (of one's heart, e.g. with excitement), to throb
to be messy (of handwriting), to be untidy
to fly about, to skip about, to bustle about
to jump down, to jump off, to jump from, to jump out of
skipping rope, jump rope
skipping, rope-jumping

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓はどのくらい↑高↑↓たか↓く↑跳↑↓と↓べますか。
↑恐↑↓こわ↓くてその↑溝↑↓みぞ↓は↑跳↑↓と↓び↑越↑↓こ↓せないよ。
sdata.e: I am afraid to jump over the ditch.

sdata.j: ↑魚↑↓さかな↓が↑水中↑↓すいちゅう↓で↑水↑↓みず↓を↑跳↑↓は↓ね↑上↑↓あ↓げているのが↑見↑↓み↓えた。
sdata.e: We saw a fish splashing in the water.

sdata.j: ボールは↑空中↑↓くうちゅう↓↑高↑↓たか↓く↑跳↑↓は↓ね↑上↑↓あ↓がった。
sdata.e: The ball bounced high in the air.

sdata.j: ボールが↑高↑↓たか↓く↑跳↑↓は↓ね↑上↑↓あ↓がった。
どうして↑私↑↓わたし↓にそんなに↑高↑↓たか↓く↑跳↑↓と↓べるでしょう。
sdata.e: How can I jump so high?

sdata.j: そのとき↑私↑↓わたし↓だけが↑小川↑↓おがわ↓を↑跳↑↓と↓び↑越↑↓こ↓すことができた。
sdata.e: Only I was able to jump across the stream then.

sdata.j: そのイナゴは↑大↑↓おお↓きく↑跳↑↓は↓ねた。
sdata.e: The locust made a big jump.

sdata.j: そして、↑飛↑↓と↓んだり、↑跳↑↓は↓ねたりしてきれいな↑水↑↓みず↓をのみました。
sdata.e: So they hopped down to the spring and drank from the clear water.

sdata.j: カール・ランジの↑記録↑↓きろく↓↑破↑↓やぶ↓りの↑幅跳↑↓はばと↓びに、↑観衆↑↓かんしゅう↓は↑息↑↓いき↓を↑呑↑↓の↓んだ。
sdata.e: Karl Lange's record breaking long jump took the crowd's breath away.

words.gloss: to jump out, to rush out, to fly out
